FuncDef:
The traffic-policy command applies a traffic policy globally.
The undo traffic-policy command cancels a traffic policy that is applied globally.
By default, no traffic policy is applied globally.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a traffic policy that is applied. The value of policy-name must be different from the policy name predefined by the system.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.

Indicates that the traffic policy is applied to the incoming packets.
The network traffic from the user side to the carrier network side is in the upstream direction.
-

Indicates that the traffic policy is applied to the outcoming packets.
The network traffic from the carrier network side to the user side is in the downstream direction.
-

Examples: Warning: After this operation is performed, the global ucl traffic policy becomes effective. Continue? [Y/N]:Y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In user access scenarios, you can run the traffic-policy command in the system view to apply a traffic policy globally. After a traffic policy is configured, the device matches user access packets based on the rules in the traffic policy.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
